results.title: The effect of acute simvastatin administration on the severity of arrhythmias resulting from ischaemia and reperfusion in the canine: Is there a role for nitric oxide?
results.text_hl: All these effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (except for the protection against @<m>DISEASE_Paroxysmal_ventricular_fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537182 @@@VF@@@) were reversed by @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@l-NAME@@@.

citations.NLM: Kisvári G, Kovács M, Gardi J, Seprényi G, Kaszaki J, Végh Á. The effect of acute simvastatin administration on the severity of arrhythmias resulting from ischaemia and reperfusion in the canine: Is there a role for nitric oxide? Eur J Pharmacol. 2014 Jun 5;732():96-104. PMID: 24685640
citations.BibTeX: @article{24685640, title={The effect of acute simvastatin administration on the severity of arrhythmias resulting from ischaemia and reperfusion in the canine: Is there a role for nitric oxide?}, author={Kisvári G and Kovács M and Gardi J and Seprényi G and Kaszaki J and Végh Á}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={732}, pages={96-104}}

results.title: The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs.
results.text_hl: Compared to the controls, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ markedly reduced the severity of @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischaemia@@@ (epicardial ST-segment, inhomogeneity) and @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ that were reversed (except the occlusion-induced @DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ [@<m>DISEASE_Paroxysmal_ventricular_fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537182 @@@VF@@@; 50%, 0%, 0%]) by the administration of @CHEMICAL_Wortmannin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077191 @@@wortmannin@@@.

citations.NLM: Kisvári G, Kovács M, Seprényi G, Végh Á. The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs. Eur J Pharmacol. 2015 Dec 15;769():185-94. PMID: 26597117
citations.BibTeX: @article{26597117, title={The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs.}, author={Kisvári G and Kovács M and Seprényi G and Végh Á}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={769}, pages={185-94}}
